ETYMOLOGY: From Old French injure, from Latin iniūria ('injustice, wrong, insult'), from in- ('not') + iūs ('right, law').

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [sb/sth] suffer an injury | cause injury to [sb/sth]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Physical harm or damage to a part of the body, typically caused by an accident or assault.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 身体部位遭受的物理性伤害或损害，通常由事故或袭击引起。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He sustained a serious injury to his knee during the football match.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他在足球比赛中膝盖受了重伤。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Harm or damage to someone's reputation, rights, or interests.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对某人的声誉、权利或利益造成的损害。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The false report caused irreparable injury to the company's reputation.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那份虚假的报告对公司的声誉造成了无法弥补的损害。

REGISTER: General, commonly used in medical, sports, legal, and everyday contexts.
